body: @yugui
@mattklein123 have a look

I hope I'm not intruding with my following naive question, since it appears that this issue is only intended for a purely technical discussion:

Will _full_ (Bidi-)streaming be supported? Because it only says this:

> 1. support any HTTP/*

and

> Pending on whatwg fetch/streams to be finalized and implemented in modern browsers

which sounds like a "no" and that would be kinda disheartening. â˜¹
If that's correct I'd be very interested in turning this into a "yes", especially since I expect Websockets (which offer that) to be more widely supported right now than fetch/streams might be in 1-2 years.
This looks good to me. This would allow us to get rid of the Envoy bridge filter hack if the protocol was widely supported.

@lhecker There is no plan to support websockets. The biggest issue with WS is that the client library still needs to fall back to HTTP. 

Server-streaming is sufficient for most use cases, e.g. when (simpler) unary calls are prohibitively expensive or slow.
@louiscryan Agreed that the http/1.1 encoding of trailers is insufficient or desired. Will fix the spec..

@wenbozhu I'm not sure if I understand this:

> The biggest issue with WS is that the client library still needs to fall back to HTTP.

Did you mean that an unary RPC call should directly map to a single HTTP request or are you referring to the fact that Websockets aren't widely supported?

> Server-streaming is sufficient for most use cases

So no Bidi-Streaming then? (Sorry for the repeated question.)

I hope I misunderstood but if not I'm sure that many others besides me would find it a bit frustrating if streaming doesn't work in its entirety.

@lhecker 

> Did you mean that an unary RPC call should directly map to a single HTTP request or are you referring to the fact that Websockets aren't widely supported?

The latter, due to proxies/firewalls etc.

> So no Bidi-Streaming then?

Correct.

@wenbozhu

> > So no Bidi-Streaming then?
> 
> Correct.

Thanks! That's just what I wanted to know.

So what's your stance on letting the community weigh in on what they want? Up till now I really get the stereotyped feeling of "Google wants this and that's how it's going to be". I mean: I could understand the sentiment since you guys are by far the leading contributors to this project, but I really hope I'm wrong again. ðŸ˜ž

<hr/>

I simply wonder why we can't have both by transparently using regular HTTP requests (like in this proposal) wherever we can and Websockets or similar where streaming is required. I don't believe anyone would be surprised by gRPC requiring proxy-incompatible technologies for Bidi-streaming where proxy-incompatibility is implied anyways already. But an immature solution for simplicities and compatibilities sake? That just screams that people will build their own solution sooner or later and I don't see why that should be any good or even needed. ðŸ˜• And if you're wondering why I'm so adamant about this, it's because I'd probably be that person who has to write an alternative solution to make streaming possible and I can't claim to be happy about duplicating the efforts. So if you need any help implementing any of this I'd be here and available, but outright dismissing it? Oh man... ðŸ˜ž

> How about we open a separate issue to discuss how to support bidi streams with grpc-web clients, after this spec has been reviewed and implemented?

Although I believe not having such a support from the get-go would be a real shame I can kinda understand that. Having a separate issue then would be more than welcomed. Do you mind opening one? ðŸ™‚ Again I'm sorry for stirring up this issue so much. I'm definitely looking forward on helping out designing and implementing such an extension. ðŸ™‚

Thanks for all the feedback. 

Plan to close the issue in a week or so. @yugui (to have a look at this spec soon ;)
LGTM

Thanks for all the feedback. 

Implementation of the new spec will happen in [grpc/grpc-web](https://github.com/grpc/grpc-web)

Ping @zinuga if you need early access to grpc-web.

@lhecker 

https://github.com/grpc/grpc-web/issues/24  (bidi support discussion)
@wenbozhu where did https://github.com/grpc/grpc-web/ gone?
@rutsky It's an early access project. Just white-listed your user id.
@zinuga could I get read permission to grpc-web?
@zinuga Could I please get early access to grpc-web?
Done. Please check.
